Authors:
AYE AYE HTUN, He Lin, Hai Feng Liu, ZHEN ZHOU XIA, Sein Lai
Lai Aung, Jian Xin Deng
Title:
.A new species and a new record of Alternaria associated with
onion leaf blight in Myanmar
Keywords:
Ascomycota; Pleosporaceae; Allium cepa; Morphology;
Phylogenetic analyses; Pathogenicity; Taxonomy; 1 new taxon
Abstract:
Onion (Allium cepa L.) is widely cultivated and an
important crop in Myanmar. The causal pathogens of blight-like symptoms
that occurred in Myanmar in 2019 were observed and identified. They were
evaluated morphological characteristics and molecular phylogenetic
analyses based on the combined gene sequences of rDNA of the internal
transcribed spacer (ITS), glyceraldehydes-3-phosphate dehydrogenase
(gapdh), Alternaria major allergen (Alt a1), translation-elongation
factor 1 alpha (tef1) and RNA polymerase second largest subunit (rpb2)
regions. According to the phylogeny, the two species clustered into
different sections. One of which was close to A. montanica in sect.
Porri, while another was A. burnsii in sect. Alternaria.
Morphologicially, the species in sect. Porri was as well distinct from
A. montanica but also different its similar species of A. cepulicola in
the sporulation pattern and conidial size, considered as a new species
described herein as A. cepae. Another species was also identical to A.
burnsii in the morphology. In addition, pathogenic assays revealed that
the two Alternaria species were the causal agents of leaf blight on
onion.
